Translations.Text: What are they asking one another
About the most important topic [of Resurrection]
Concerning which they differ
No, they will soon come to know
No, no, they will soon come to know [the Truth]
Have We not made the earth specially prepred [for sustenance of life]
And the mountains as stabilisers
And We created you in pairs
And We made your sleep a means of rest
And We made the night as cover
And We made the day for earning a livelihood
And We have built above you seven strong [firmaments/heavens/atmospeherioc layers]
And We have made a blazing source of light
And We send water pouring down in abundance from the rain-bearing clouds
So that We may produce therewith grain and vegetation
And gardens luxuriant
Indeed, the Day of Decision is a divinely appointed time
When that Day the trumpet is blown, you come out in droves
And the heaven is opened as if it were gates
And the mountains are moved away, as if they had been a mirage
Indeed, Hell is waiting
As home for the transgressors
They shall remain therein for ages
They shall taste therein neither coolness nor any drink
But boiling water and a pus-like thing
An appropriate recompense
They never expected to be called to account
And they falsely rejected Our signs/Verses
And We have recorded everything in a Book
So taste now [the punishment;] for, now, We shall increase on you nothing but punishment
Indeed, for the pious ones, there is salvation
[They shall be in] gardens and vineyards
And [with] likeable companions
And cups filled to the brim
They shall not hear any idle talk, or any lies, therein
[Their life in the Hereafter] will be a reward from your Lord, a measured gift
The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, the Gracious! None shall have it in their power [in His presence] to address Him
The Day the Spirit and the angels stand in rows, none shall speak except those whom the Lord of Mercy permits, and who will say only what is right
That Day is sure to come. So let him, who wishes to, take the right path to return to his Lord
We have warned you of Punishment that is near. The Day when it comes, man shall see what his hands had sent ahead, and he who has suppressed the Truth shall say, "Oh, would that I were dust
By those that dive and extract
And by those [winds?] that briskly pass by
And by the floaters [clouds?] that float by
And then overtake others, leaving the latter behind
And then execute a [divine] Order [to rain]
[There shall come] a Day when a violent convulsion will convulse [the world]
The subsequent convulsion shall follow the first
Hearts that Day will be throbbing
Sights that Day will be lowered
They ask, "Shall we be brought back to life [after death]
Even when we are crumbled bones
They say, "This in that event would be a damaging return
It will but be a single blast
And then they all will come awake [from their deep slumber of death]
Has Moses' story come down to you
When his Lord called out to him by the sacred valley of Tuwa
Go to Pharaoh! He has indeed exceeded all bounds
You then ask him, `Would you like to reform
Would you allow me to guide you to your Lord, so that you fear Him
Moses then showed him the great Sign [staff turning into snake and hand turning white]
But he [Pharaoh] refused to acknowledge the divine Sign and obey Allah
He then turned his back hastily
To summon and collect his people
He then proclaimed to them, "I am your lord supreme
Allah then seized him for punishment both in the Hereafter and here
There is indeed a lesson in this for those who fear Allah
Are you more difficult to create or the heaven to construct
HE raised its structure and then balanced it aright
And made its night dark and its day bright
And the earth thereafter â€” He spread it out
He brought out from it its water and its pasture
And He made the mountains firm
[He has provided] means of sustenance for you and your animals
So when the great event occurs
That Day man would recount what he strove for
And the Hell would be made manifest for all to see
And then anyone who had transgressed divinely set bounds
And had preferred the life of this world
That one's abode shall indeed be in Hell
And one who had been afraid of standing before his Lord and had restrained one's self from carnal desires
That one's abode shall indeed be in Paradise
They ask you [Prophet] about the Hour (the time when the present world will end and the Hereafter begin), "When is it coming
What have you to do with the mentioning of it [the time of the occurrence of the Hour]
With your Lord rests the final and only Authority to know when the Hour would happen
You [Prophet] are but a warner for those who fear it [the Hour]
The Day they see it [the Hereafter], they will feel as if they had stayed for only one evening or one morning thereof
He frowned and turned away
That the blind man came to him
And what do you know? He might reform [to become a righteous man]
Or, he might deliberate and the deliberation might benefit him
Now he who is well-to-do
To him you pay attention
And [even when] it is not your responsibility if he would not reform
And he who comes to you in earnest
And fears (Allah)
By him then are you distracted
No! [Your resentment at the blind man's intrusion is not right.] This [Qur'aan] is only an open source of divine Admonition to recite
So whoso wills may recite it and take heed from
In records honourable
Exalted and purified
By hands of scribes
Noble and virtuous
Man be damned, how ungrateful is he
Out of what thing did He create him
HE created him out of fertilized ovum and then moulded him in due proportion
And then made the path of life convenient for him
And then He caused him to die and consigned him to dust
And then, whenever He wishes, He will raise him back to life
No! Man did certainly not carry out what Allah had asked him to do
Let man just look at his food
[To enable man to get his food] We poured water [rain] in showers
And We pierced the soil, so that it got soaked [with rain water]
Then We caused grain to grow therein
And grapevines and vegetables
And olive-trees and palm-trees
And luxuriant orchards
And fruits and fodder
As provision for you and your cattle
Then as the deafening blast occurs
On the Day when every man would flee from his brother
And his mother and his father
And his spouse and his children
On that Day everyone among them will be preoccupied with his own individual concerns
Faces that Day would be beaming
Cheerful and joyous
Faces that Day would be gloomy
Darkness covering them
Those would be the ones suppressing the Truth, the ones wicked
When the sun is folded up
And when the stars lose their lustre
And when the mountains are moved
And when the ten-months pregnant camels are abandoned
And when the wild beasts are gathered
And when the seas overflow
And when the souls are rejoined (with their bodies)
And when the girl-child buried alive shall be asked
For what sin was she killed
And when the scrolls [of human deeds] are laid open
And when the sky is stripped off
And the Hell stoked
And the Paradise brought near
Every person comes to know what he has brought along
No! [The misgivings of the people that do not believe in these revelations are not correct, and] I swear by the stars
That retreat and hide
And by the night as it moves
And the morning as it breathes
This is indeed the word of a noble [Angel] Messenger
A mighty One with the Lord of the Throne
One to be obeyed besides being trustworthy
And your companion [Prophet Muhammad] is not mad
And he did certainly see the Angel Messenger on the clear horizon
And he [Prophet] does not grudge (conveying what has been revealed to him) of the Unseen
And it is not a word of accursed Satan
Where then are you going
This is nothing but Good Counsel for the worlds
For any of you who wishes to follow the Straight Way
And you wish not unless Allah, the Lord of the Universe, so wishes
When the sky breaks
And when the stars disperse
And when the seas overflow
And when the graves are uncovered, taken out and examined
Every soul comes to know what it had sent ahead and what it had left behind
O human! What has deluded you away from your Lord, the Most Noble
HE is the One Who created you, then moulded you, and then gave you a good poise
HE cast you into an appearance He willed
And, yet, you refused to believe in the Judgment Day
And certainly indeed Guards are appointed to keep watch on you and protect you
Noble recorders are they [recording all your omissions and commissions]
They know what you do
Indeed, the righteous will be in bliss
And certainly indeed, the wicked persons will be in Hell
They will enter it on the day of Judgment
And they will not be absent from it
And what do you understand what the Day of Judgment is
Repeat, what do you understand what the Day of Judgment is
That Day no creature shall be of any avail to another. And Allah's shall be the sole command that Day
Woe to those who defraud
Those who, when they take anything by measure from others, take it in full
And who, when they measure or weigh things to give to others, give fraudulently less
Do they not think they will be raised to life again, after death
For a great Day
The Day when mankind shall stand before the Lord of the worlds
No indeed! [Mankind shall not be left unjudged.] The record of the the wicked persons is in Sijjeen
And what do you understand what Sijjeen is
It is a written record
Woe that Day to those who had denied the Truth
Those who had denied the Day of Judgement
None but those transgressing with criminal intent deny it
When Our Verses are recited to them, they say, "Fables of the ancient peoples
No! On the contrary, what they have been earning with their own deeds has made their minds dirty
No indeed! On that day they shall certainly be shut out from the presence of their Lord
And then they shall indeed suffer the blazing Fire of Hell
And then they will be told, "This is what you had been denying
But the record of the righteous peope is in Illiyyeen
And what do you understand what Illiyyoon is
It is a written record
Those closest to Allah are witnesses thereto
The righteous people will indeed be in bliss
[From their seats] on couches, they will look around them
In their faces you shall recognise the glow of bliss
They will be given to drink of sealed nectar
Sealed with [fragrance of] musk. And for this let the aspirants aspire
And it will be a blend with [the waters of] Tasneem
A fountain from which those who are closest to Allah will drink
Indeed those who do sinful acts laugh at the believers
And they [mischievously] wink at one another as they pass by them
And when they go back to people of their own kind, they go back cracking jokes about them (believers)
And when they see them [their own people], they tell them, "These people [believers] have indeed gone astray
And they [non-believers] are not sent as guardians over them [believers]
This Day [of Judgement] then the believers will laugh at those that had been suppressing the Truth
As they [believers] look around them [seated comfortably] upon their couches [and ruminate]
Are not the suppressors of Truth duly requited for what they used to do
When the sky splits asunder
And responds to its Lord, and it is bound [to respond]
And when the earth is levelled
And it throws out its contents, and becomes void
And responds to its Lord, and it is bound [to respond]
O human! You do indeed have to put in hard labour to go to your Lord, and then you meet Him
And as for him whose book of deeds is placed in his right hand
He will then face his accounting with ease
And he will turn to his own people in joy
And as for him whose book of deeds is given to him behind his back
He will pray for [his own death and] destruction
And he will burn in blazing Fire
He had indeed been living happily engrossed [on earth] among people of his own kind
He had indeed thought he would never return [to life]
Yes indeed! His Lord had kept a watch over him
But no! [He shall not continue to remain dead.] I swear by the afterglow of sunset
And by the night, and what it veils in its darkness
And by the moon, at its full
You [humans] do move from stage to stage
Then how come they believe not [in a life to come]
And when the Qur'aan is read out to them, they prostrate not
On the contrary, they who suppress the truth dny it [this divine writ]
And Allah knows what they keep to themselves
So give them the prospect of grievous suffering [in the life to come]
But not to those who believe and do good deeds. For them is there a reward unending
By the sky, with its constellations of stars
And by the Day [of Judgment] promised
And witness [giving evidence in favour of or against anything on the Judgment Day] and those for or against whom the witness is giving evidence
Damned are the owners of the ditc
Of the fuel-filled fire
When they sat by it
And witnessed what they did to the believers
And they took vengeance on them for nothing else but that they believed in Allah, the Omnipotent, the Embodiment of Praise
To Whom belongs the Absolute Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Witness to all things
Surely indeed, those who persecute believing men and believing women and repent not â€” for them will be the punishment of Hell, and for them the punishment by the Fire
Surely indeed, those who believe and do good deeds â€” for them will be Gardens underneath which rivers flow. That is the Greatest Success
Indeed, the Hold of your Lord is certainly severe
It is He indeed Who does the original creation, and Who is capable of resurrecting His original creation when it is dead
And He is the One Forgiving, Loving
Lord of the Glorious Throne
HE does what He wills
Have you come to know the story of the armies
Of Pharaoh and of (the ancient tribe of) Thamood
Yet, [despite knowing the story of how those ancient peoples were destroyed for their transgressions] those that suppress the Truth live in denial
And Allah surrounds them unawares
Nay, [non-believers' denial notwithstanding,] this is a glorious Qur'an
In a well-protected format
By the sky and the Taariq
â€” And what do you understand what the Taariq is
It is the shining star â€”
Not a soul but has a protector over it
Let man then see how he is created
He is created by means of fluid [blood] spurting
Out from between the spine and the ribs
It [blood] is certainly indeed capable of its return
The Day secrets are disclosed
For him [man] there will then be no power, and no helper
By the sky, ever returning [revolving]
And by the earth with its surface cracking open again and again with new growth of plants and vegetation
It [Qur'aan] is indeed a decisive Word
And it is not for just sport and amusement
They [suppressors of Truth] are indeed hatching a plot
And I [Allah] am devising a plot
So let those who suppress the Truth go their way; let them go for a little while
Glorify the name of your Lord, the Most High
Who created and gave the things created good shape
And Who determined [the span of existence for the things created] and guided them
And Who brought out the verdure [on the earth]
And then made it into dark rubble
We shall make you recite and then you will not forget
Except for what Allah wills. HE knows what is manifest and what is hidden
And We shall make things easy for you
Should the divine Words of the Qur'aan benefit them, do recite these to them
He who fears (Allah) shall take heed therefrom
And he who is wicked will shun it
He who will burn in the Great Fire
Then he will neither die in it, nor live
He will surely attain salvation who keeps himself pure [in worldly life]
And oft-remembers his LordÕ³ name and then prays to Him
But no, you prefer this worldly life
Whereas the Hereafter is better and enduring
This fact, indeed, was [also stated] in the earlier Scriptures â€”
The Scriptures of Abraham and Moses
Have you heard about the Overwhelming Event
Faces that Day will be down
Wrought-up, weary
Burning in Fire intensely hot
Made to drink from a boiling hot spring
No food for them but of thorns
That neither nourishes nor satisfies hunger
Faces that Day will be blissful
Pleased with their efforts
In lofty Garden
Wherein no vain talk will you hear
Therein a fountain flowing
Therein thrones raised high
And cups placed conveniently
And cushions in rows
And carpets spread out
Do they not see how the cloud is created
And the sky, how it is raised high
And the mountains, how they are rooted
And the earth, how its surface is made
So recite the divine Verses to the people at large. Your only responsibility is to recite
You have no control over them
But he who turns back and suppresses the Truth
Allah will give him the greatest punishment
To Us indeed is their return
Then it is for Us to call them to account
By the dawn
And the ten nights
And the even and the odd
And by the night as it passes
Is there in this an oath for one with understanding
Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with AAad
[The anscient people] of Iram, [city of] lofty-pillared buildings
Like which no city had ever been created on the lands
And [another ancient people of] Thamood who hewed the rocks in the valley [to carve out buildings therefrom]
And Pharaoh of the many tent pegs (i.e. with means and power)
Who committed transgression in the lands
They often spread anarchy in them
Then their Lord lashed them with whip of punishment
Indeed, your Lord is ever watchful
Then as his Lord tests him by bestowing honour and bounties upon him, man says, "My Lord has honoured me
And as He tests him by restricting his provision, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me
No! On the contrary, you do not treat the orphan honourably
And urge not one another to feed the poor
And devour the inheritance â€” devouring it all
And love the worldly wealth â€” loving it immensely
[And] no, [the Lord does not restrict His provisions to man to humiliate him]! When the earth is pounded to make it level
And when your Lord reveals Himself with rows upon rows of angels
And Hell brought near, that Day will man remember [what the Qur'aan had told him]! Of what avail will that remembering be to him
Man will say, "Would that I had sent ahead for this life of mine
Then, on that Day, Allah will punish him as none other can
And bind him as none other can
O you contented soul
Return to your Lord pleased [with yourself], pleasing (to your Lord)
Enter then to be among My devotees
And enter My Garden
No! I do swear by this City
â€” And you are a free citizen of this City â€”
And by father and that which he begets
We have certainly created man for hard work
Does he think that no one has any control over him
He claims, "I have squandered much wealth
Does he think no one is keeping a watch on him
Have We not made two eyes for him
And a tongue and two lips
And shown him the two ways [right and wrong]
But he ventures not up the steep road
And what do you understand what the steep road is
Freeing a slave
Or feeding on a day of extreme hunger
An orphan closely related
Or miserable poor man
Then he becomes of those who believe and exhort one another to patience, and exhort one another to mercy
These are the people of the right hand
And those who suppress the Truth in Our Verses, those are the people of the left hand
On them is Fire closing in
By the sun and its brightness
And by the moon as it reflects it [brightness of the Sun]
And by the day, when it displays it [brightness of the Sun]
And by the night, when it veils it [brightness of the Sun]
And by the sky and what it constitutes
And by the earth and what makes it spread [prolong] its existence
And by the soul and what shapes it
Then inspired it with knowledge of what is wrong for it and what is right
Certainly, the one who keeps it [soul] pure is successful
And, certainly, the one who corrupts it is ruined
The people of Thamood denied the Truth by committing transgression
When the most wicked man among them came forward [to disobey divine directive]
Allah's Messenger had then warned them about Allah's she-camel and her [allotted time of] drink
But they rejected him, and crippled her. For this sin of theirs, their Lord let loose His anger upon them, and razed their dwellings to the ground
And He has not to be afraid of its consequences
By the night as it veils
And by the day as it unveils
And by the Power that created the male and the female
Indeed, your [mankind's] work is in divergent fields of activity
And, he who gave [things in Allah's Path] and feared Him
And stood firmly by what was good and right
For him shall We make things easy
And he who was miserly [in giving things in Allah's Path], and considered that he needed no divine help
And belied what was good and right
For him shall We make things difficult
And his wealth shall avail him not when he drops dead
It is certainly indeed for Us to give the guidance
And, certainly indeed, the Dominion over both the Hereafter and the present world is Ours
I then warn you of the flaming Fire
None shall burn in it [the Fire] but the wicked person
He who belies the Truth and turns away [from it]
And, he will be distanced from it [Fire] who fears Allah
He who spends his wealth [on others] to keep himself pure
â€” And he has none with him to be recompensed of favours received â€”
And he spends for nothing but to seek the pleasure of his Lord, the Most High
And such persons, certainly, shall in time be well-pleased
By the morning brightness
And by the night when it is still
Your Lord has not forsaken you [Prophet Muhammad], nor does He hate you
And, surely, the latter part [of your life] will be better for you than the earlier
And surely your Lord will give you [stability, security and authority], and then you will be happy
Did He not find you an orphan and give you shelter
Did He not find you wandering and give you guidance
Did He not find you poor and make you overcome poverty
Oppress not the orphan then
And scare not the beggar away
And recount then the bounty of your Lord
Have We not opened for you your head
And lifted your burden off you
Which [burden] weighed upon your back
And raised high the esteem, (in which) you (are held), for you
With every difficulty then, indeed, there is a way out
Indeed, with every difficulty there is a way out
So then, when you get free (of your difficulty or from your worldly task), rise up
And turn to your Lord in complete devotion and submission
By the fig and the olive
And by Mount Sinai
And by this city (Makkah) of peace
Surely, We created the human in the best of forms
Then We reverted the human to the lowest of the low
Except for those who believed and did righteous deeds. For them, an unending reward
What, then, do they deny you [O Prophet] for, post this Judgment [in Verses and above]
Is not Allah the Best of all judges
Read in the name of your Lord who creates â€”
Creates man from a clinging substance
Read and your Lord is most Liberal
Who taught by the pen â€”
Taught mankind what it knew not.h
Man, on the other hand, is certainly indeed prone to transgression
As he sees himself independent of any divine help
Indeed, to your Lord is the return
Have you seen him who forbids
A devotee when he prays
Do you see if he [the devotee] is on the right guidance
Or enjoins piety
[And] do you see if he [who forbids the devotee from praying] denies [Guidance] and turns away [from it]
Does he not know that Allah does indeed see [his wickedness]
Nay! If he does not desist, We will drag him by the forelock â€”
A lying, sinning forelock
Then let him call those who would help him
We will call the guardians of Hell
Nay! Obey him not, but prostrate and get near (to Allah)
We have indeed bestowed it [the Qur'aan] in the night of Divine Decree
And what do you understand what the night of divine Decree is
The night of divine Decree is better than a thousand months
The angels and the Spirit, by their Lord's leave, descend in that night with all His decrees
Peace it is, until the break of dawn
It could not be that those suppressing the Truth from among the people of the Book [Jews and Christians] and the polytheists were abandoned [by Allah], until there came to them the clear evidence
A Messenger from Allah, reciting scripts freed of all impurities
In it are rulings sound, clear and ever applicable
And those who have been given the divine Book [earlier] differed not but after the clear evidence had come to them

And they were enjoined not but to worship Allah, keeping their way of life exclusively for Him, turning away from all that was false; and to establish the prayer ; and to give the Zakaat. And this is the way of life sound, clear and ever applicable

Indeed, those who suppress the Truth from among the peoples who had been given the divine Book earlier and the polytheists â€” those will be in the fire of Hell, therein to abide: they are the worst of all creatures
Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds â€” it is they who are the best of all creatures

Their reward with their Lord: gardens of perpetual bliss, underneath which rivers flow, wherein to abide forever. Allah will be well-pleased with them, and they with Him. All this for him who fears his Lord
When the earth is shaken with its earthquake
And the earth brings out its burdens
And man wonders, "What is the matter with it
That Day it [the earth] will relate its stories
Because your Lord inspires it
That Day mankind will proceed in groups to be shown their deeds
Then whoever does [even] an atom's weight of good deed will see it
And whoever does [even] an atom's weight of bad deed will see it
By the chargers [horses ridden by warriors] panting
Then striking the sparks of fire
Then raiding at dawn
Then raising the dust therewith
Then charging into the midst collectively therewith
Man certainly indeed is ungrateful to his Lord
And he certainly indeed bears witness on this (that he is ungrateful)
And he is certainly indeed extremely fond of wealth
Does he not know that when the contents of the graves are taken out and examined
And that which was in (human) minds recovered
Their Lord shall have been well-aware of them, that Day
The Sudden Calamity
What is the Sudden Calamity
And what do you know what the Sudden Calamity is
It is a Day when mankind shall be like the scattered moths
And the mountains like fluffed up wool
That person, then, who weighs heavy [with good deeds] on the scales
[That person] shall have a pleasant life
And that person, who weighs light [because of bad deeds] on the scales
The Abyss then shall be his home
And what do you understand what it [the Abyss] is
A Fire intensely hot
The craving for more [worldly wealth and power] keeps you engrossed
Until you embrace the graves
Nay! You shall soon come to know
Nay again! You shall soon come to know
Nay, if you but knew with certain knowledge
You shall surely see the Hell
Then you shall surely see it with eye of certitude
And then, on that Day, you shall surely be questioned about the bounties you enjoyed
By the time
Indeed, mankind is surely in loss
But not those among them who believe and do good deeds, and exhort one another to Truth, and exhort one another to patience
Woe to everyone who taunts, slanders, or backbites others
Who hoards wealth and keeps on counting it [avariciously]
Thinking his wealth will last forever for him
Nay! He will surely be thrown into the Crushing Disaster
And what do you know what the Crushing Disaster is
It is the Fire kindled by Allah
That which would ride over human minds
It would be closing in on them from everyside
In extended columns
Have you not seen what your Lord did to the companions of the elephant
Did He not bring their plan to naught
And send upon them swarms of birds
Pelting them with stones of baked clay
And then making them look like chewed husk?h
For the welfare of the Qurays
Their welfare during winter and summer journeys [of their trading caravans]
So let them worship the Lord of this House
Who provided them food against hunger and security against fear
Have you seen the one who denies that there is a just divine system in place for mankind
Such a one it is that pushes the orphan away
And does not motivate others on feeding the poor
And, woe to those who pray â€”
Those who are neglectful of, and/or inattentive in, their Prayers
Those who show off
And refuse to give even trifling things to others
We have indeed given you the amplitude
So pray to your Lord and offer sacrifice for Him
Your enemy is the one to be cut off
Say, "O you who suppress the Truth
I worship not that which you worship
And you worship not Him Whom I worship
And I shall worship not that which you worship
And you worship not Him Whom I worship
For you your way of life and for me, mine
When Allah's help and the victory have come
And you see people entering Allah-ordained way of life for mankind, in large numbers
Then glorify your Lord with His praise, and seek His forgiveness. HE is indeed the One to accept repentance
Abu Lahab's hands are perished; and he too
His wealth and what he earned was of no avail to him
[In the life to come] he shall burn in a Fire of blazing flames
Along with his wife, carrier of (thorny) wood â€”
A rope of twisted strands in her neck
Say, "He is Allah, the One and Only
Allah, the eternal and independent Lord and Master on Whom everything in the Universe depends
He begets not nor is He begotten
And there is none comparable to Him
Say, "I seek refuge in Lord of the dawn
From the evil of what He has created
And from the evil of darkness when it sets in
And from the evil of those who blow on knots
And from the evil of the envious person when he envies
Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind
King of mankind
One Whom mankind should worship
From the evil of the temptations, doubts and suggestions of the stealthy whisperer
â€” One who puts the evil things in minds of mankind â€”
From among the jinn and mankind
